items.title: Best Buy’s early Black Friday sale delivers up to $900 off RTX 50-series gaming laptops and desktops, deals from $229

Alongside its ongoing Copilot+ PC discounts that are offering up to $600 off some of the newest models, Best Buy has also rolled out some solid deals on gaming laptops and desktops powered by RTX 50-series GPUs. As part of its early Black Friday sale, you can cash in and score savings of up to $900 on some powerful machines that are now starting as low as $229. We’ve rounded up some of the top picks from the sale below, so be sure to check them out while they last.

items.title: Mamdani victory fires up Europe's left against right-wing surge at home
items.summary: LONDON/BERLIN (Reuters) -The blistering rise of Zohran Mamdani to become mayor of New York City has offered encouragement to left-wing parties across Europe that an unabashedly radical agenda could help turn the tide against right-wing forces at home. Read full story

items.title: German nurse given life sentence for murdering 10 patients
items.summary: BERLIN (Reuters) -A palliative nurse was convicted on Wednesday of the murder of 10 patients with lethal injections and the attempted murder of 27 others and was handed a life sentence by a German court. Read full story

items.title: 'One of us': Ugandan pride in New York mayor with roots in their country
items.summary: A professor describes Mamdani as "one of us" while some young Ugandans take inspiration from the 34-year-old's victory.

items.title: Replika founder raises $20M pre-seed for Wabi, the ‘YouTube of apps’
items.summary: Wabi, a startup from the founder of Replika, has just raised a $20 million pre-seed round. Wabi is like "YouTube for apps" -- a social platform where anyone can use prompts to instantly create mini apps and share them with friends.

items.title: Nintendo is getting the Switch ready for retirement
items.summary: Nintendo is stepping further away from its original Switch console, with the company now planning to dedicate most of its attention to its successor. In a financial results briefing on Wednesday, Nintendo said that “going forward, we will shift our primary development focus to Nintendo Switch 2 and expand our business around this new platform.” […]

items.title: Discord now lets parents control who contacts their teens, but messages stay private
items.summary: Discord is expanding the safety controls parents and guardians have access to in its Family Center, including increased visibility of their teens’ activity, allowing guardians to control sensitive content filtering and data privacy settings, and giving them more control over who can DM their teens.  New Social Permissions toggles will allow guardians to choose whether […]

items.title: Google makes it easier to access AI Mode in Chrome on iOS and Android
items.summary: Users will now be able to access AI Mode via a new dedicated shortcut button under the search bar when opening a "New Tab" page in Chrome.

items.title: Microsoft built a fake marketplace to test AI agents — they failed in surprising ways
items.summary: Researchers at Microsoft have developed a new simulation environment for testing AI agents, revealing surprising weaknesses in the current state-of-the-art.

items.title: You can keep using your iPad as an Apple Home hub until February
items.summary: If you’ve been reluctant to update to the new Apple Home architecture, you now have a few more months before Apple forces your hand. Apple has pushed back the deadline to February 10, 2026, rather than fall 2025.  The refreshed version of Apple Home has been available for a couple of years now and adds […]

items.title: This AI smart ring lets you record voice notes with a whisper
items.summary: Another AI-powered wearable is coming to market. It’s not a pendant like Friend, nor a wristband like Amazon’s Bee. This time, it’s a smart ring called the Stream Ring from the company Sandbar founded by former employees of the neural interface startup CTRL-Labs that was acquired by Meta. Users can preorder the Stream Ring now […]

items.title: Amazon opens a new 10,000-square-foot automated Whole Foods store in Pennsylvania partly staffed by robots; customers can scan and order items from the aisles (Matt Day/Bloomberg)
items.summary:
Matt Day / Bloomberg:
Amazon opens a new 10,000-square-foot automated Whole Foods store in Pennsylvania partly staffed by robots; customers can scan and order items from the aisles  —  Amazon.com Inc. has combined a Whole Foods Market store with a mini warehouse stocked with products the chain hasn't previously sold.

items.title: T-Mobile brings free 911 emergency texting to AT&T and Verizon customers
items.summary: T-Mobile is opening up access to its Starlink-powered emergency texting service. The carrier announced on Wednesday that anyone with a compatible phone — even AT&T and Verizon customers — can sign up to text 911 over satellite for free. In July, T-Mobile launched its “T-Satellite” service to customers across the US for $10 per month, […]

items.title: EcoFlow’s DELTA Pro Ultra and DELTA 3 Ultra power stations get up to $2,779 exclusive savings to new lows from $949
items.summary:
We’ve secured some exclusive savings from Wellbots on two EcoFlow units that give you new low prices, like the largest DELTA Pro Ultra Whole-Home Backup Power Station coming with a FREE 400W solar panel at $3,599 shipped, after using the code 10BF9TO5 at checkout. While this station carries a $6,098 MSRP directly from the brand, it’s coming down at Wellbots from a $5,799 full price, with discounts having seen the price taken as low as $3,999 from EcoFlow and Amazon, while a previous exclusive deal back from April saw it go further to $3,799. Today’s exclusive deal drops costs further than we’ve tracked before, giving you a $2,200 price cut on the station alongside the $579 value of the free solar panel for a new all-time low price and $2,779 in total savings. You’ll also find the brand’s newest DELTA 3 Ultra Portable Power Station hitting a new low of $949 shipped, after using the exclusive code 150BF9TO5 at checkout. Head below to learn more about these two backup power solutions.

Since hitting the market in June, this newer unit has carried a $2,599 full price tag outside of sales/discounts, with this all-time low having first appeared during last month’s Prime Day event and then repeating during the brand’s previous Halloween Sale. items.title: Score this Qi2 15W 3-in-1 station to charge your Apple everyday carry while it’s just $18 (50% off)
items.summary:
ESR 15W Qi2 3-in-1 charging station

Buy for $18 (Reg. $36.50)

Enter promo code I9NCH4GV for $17.99 off.

What we love

You’ll come across plenty of Qi2-certified chargers on the market – including some of the newer 25W Qi2.2 options – but it’s rare to find one with such a steep discount. This is easily among the most affordable Qi2 chargers around at the moment, and it offers a 15W Qi2 wireless pad with MagSafe support for your iPhone, along with dedicated spots to charge your Apple Watch and AirPods. It’s a solid charging station overall for Apple users looking to get a new charging station up and running at their desk.

items.title: Bolivia Supreme Court orders release of ex-President Anez

items.title: From Pokrovsk defenders: drones alone can't hold embattled Ukrainian city
items.summary: KYIV/EASTERN UKRAINE, Ukraine (Reuters) -As buildings change hands in chaotic fighting in Ukraine's eastern stronghold of Pokrovsk, defending forces said this week that drones alone could not hold off Russian advances and more soldiers were needed to prevent the enemy infiltrating further. Read full story

items.title: Score a deal on Donkey Kong Bananza for Switch 2 + price drops on Zelda, Kirby, more
items.summary:

You can now grab what is thus regraded as one of, if not, the best Switch 2 exclusive games down at $61.99 Prime shipped from the regular $70 list. That might not seem like a huge discount, and we have yet to get official word on Nintendo’s Black Friday plans, but I don’t think anyone expects to see official price drops on this one for the holidays (at least not from Nintendo). 

  • Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – Switch 2 Edition $63 (Reg. $70)
  • Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Switch 2 Edition $70 (Reg. $80)
  • Mario Kart World $70 (Reg. $80)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land – Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World $70 (Reg. $80)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree – Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV $70 (Reg. $80)
